intro: Chrysophyllum boivinianum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces edible, yellow-orange fruits with a crisp, juicy pulp and a sweet, aromatic flavor. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of food in its native region. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
